kick around.translation[0].definitions[0: to think about or discuss an idea before making a decision
We kicked that suggestion around and in the end decided to go ahead.
kick around.translation[0].definitions[1: to treat someone badly and unfairly
I have my pride, you know. They can’t kick me around.
kick around.translation[0].definitions[2: to be in a place doing things, but without any firm plans
He kicked around India for a few months.
kick around.translation[0].definitions[3: to be left in a place untidily or forgotten
There’s a copy of the report kicking around somewhere.
